      • reverse2

        public static java.lang.String reverse2​(java.lang.String str,
                                        int start)
        Helper function used for reversing the string. Used position of the string instead of a substring since producing substring has a linear execution time and i am not sure if it is using a loop inside
        Parameters:
        str - string to breversed
        start - current position of the string
        Returns:
        reversed string

      • isElfish

        public static boolean isElfish​(java.lang.String word,
                               int start,
                               boolean e,
                               boolean l,
                               boolean f)
        Helper funciton for checking the elfish function
        Parameters:
        word - word to be checked
        start - position in the work that is being checked( not using the substring for the same reason )
        e - boolean value for e( true if e has been found, false otherwise )
        l - boolean value for l( true if e has been found, false otherwise )
        f - boolean value for f( true if e has been found, false otherwise )
        Returns:
        true if the word is elfish and false other wise( all the boolean paramteres need to be true for the output to be true )

                            int i,
                            int j,
                            int minI)
        Helper function for recursivly sorting
        Parameters:
        arr - array to be sorted
        i - index it is currently at
        j - index of subarray in which the minimal element is to be found and placed in its right place
        minI - index of the minimum element in the array

      • evaluatePostfixRec

        public static double evaluatePostfixRec​(java.lang.String expr)
        Postfix expression evauation
        Parameters:
        expr - String of our postfix expresion( every operator and operation are separated with a space here
        Returns:
        returns the result as a double value since division and mutltiplication are allowed

      • evaluatePostfixRec

        public static double evaluatePostfixRec​(java.lang.String expr,
                                        java.util.Stack<java.lang.Double> stack,
                                        int i)
        Helper function for our postfix evauation
        Parameters:
        expr - String ( postfix expression )
        stack - stack which manipuates operations
        i - position in the string we are currently at( again used this instead of substring for the same reason as in the previous examples )
        Returns:
        the result of Postfix expresion we are evaluating

      • evaluatePrefixRec

        public static double evaluatePrefixRec​(java.lang.String expr)
        Evaluating prefix expression( almost th esame as for the postfix one with difference in the way the string is reverse and the was stack's operands are pushed and popped
        Parameters:
        expr - prefix expression as a string
        Returns:
        the value of the expression

      • evaluatePrefixRec

        public static double evaluatePrefixRec​(java.lang.String expr,
                                       java.util.Stack<java.lang.Double> stack,
                                       int i)
        helper method which is pretty similar to the one we used as a helper for postfix evaluation
        Parameters:
        expr - prefix expression
        stack - stack used for evaluating
        i - position in the string we are currently at
        Returns:
        evaluated value of the prefix expression

      • evaluate

        public static double evaluate​(double first_operand,
                              double second_operand,
                              java.lang.String operation)
        Used for both prefix and postfix recursive methods. This is a method with constant complexity that evaluates two operators and an operation
        Parameters:
        first_operand - left value
        second_operand - right value
        operation - binary operation to be performed
        Returns:
        returns the evaluated expression

      • printRec

        public static void printRec​(int[][] arr)
        Operation used to print a 2d array in clockwise form
        Parameters:
        arr - array to be printed

      • printRec

        public static void printRec​(int[][] arr,
                            int l_l,
                            int r_l,
                            int u_l,
                            int d_l,
                            int i,
                            int j,
                            boolean r,
                            boolean d,
                            boolean l,
                            boolean u)
        Helper function for printing a 2d array
        Parameters:
        arr - array to be print
        l_l - left limit( left bound )
        r_l - right limit( right bound )
        u_l - upper limit( upper bound )
        d_l - down limit( down bound )
        i - current row position
        j - current column position
        r - boolean ( right direction - moving )
        d - boolean ( down direction - moving )
        l - boolean ( left direction - moving )
        u - boolean ( up direction - moving )

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
